name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Newcastle International Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic way to start your holiday abroad. Lovely spacious rooms, which are spotless, lovely large bed, tea and coffee making in room. En suite very large and clean.
reviews.title: Double trees by Hilton Newcastle airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant is well worth a visit, also a good bar menu.
reviews.title: fab hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Excellent service, they arrange for your car to be picked up outside the hotel and it is waiting for you on return. Only 1 minute walk to the airport.
reviews.title: Fabulous!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel twice once travelling with ladies and once with hubby both stays were excellent check in fast and efficient lovely rooms had dinner in the italian restaurant which was great nice atmosphere with good food and not overpriced already booked for January.
reviews.title: Another good stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in!!
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013
reviews.text: This is the second time I've stayed in a doubletree (previously in York) and both experiences were wonderful. Lovely room, enormous comfortable bed, immaculate bathroom, very nice room service dinner and a good breakfast buffet. Free wifi was appreciated although it was slow and I couldn't get my iPad connected to it although my iPhone and laptop did. The hotel staff knew about 'an issue with Apple'. And I hope they manage to sort it.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel, and any Doubletree wholeheartedly.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here on business for 1 night.
reviews.title: This hotel has it cracked!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in easy and straight forward.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013
reviews.text: Left my car in the underground car park for £5.
reviews.title: Quality hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: You cannot go far wrong with this hotel for convenience and location. It is perfect for a night and you can walk across to the airport. The staff are very attentive and friendly.
reviews.title: Fantastic Airport Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very quiet even when the hotel is full the noise is very contained. Being so close to the airport one would expect to be woken by aircraft taking off and landing, not so. The glazing appears to keep all the noise out.
reviews.title: Handy Hilton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the down side it can get stifling hot in the summer here (not a problem we have very often). Sadly the air-con is not functional in all the rooms. The staff try and help with change of rooms etc. which is fine if it is only for one night. Staying a week is an entirely different story and a fan that blows at floor level and needs re timing every 120 minutes does not cut the mustard. Luckily the staff came to the rescue again (this time a very nice lady from the cleaning staff) and supplied a more substantial fan.
reviews.title: Great convenient hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: It is a shame under these circumstances that the windows cannot be opened. Must be a lot cheaper though to have hotels with glass panels rather than windows (one less thing that can break). Some of the rooms have leaking showers where the shower doors came out of alignment. Again the staff are always very helpful and pass these on to the maintenance crew. With not much of a result though. Again if you only stay for one night its fine.
reviews.title: First Class Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is such a lovely hotel as a whole and just needs a little continuous TLC.
reviews.title: Mdoern and convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is great my husband and I have stayed here on numerous occasions, you get a lovely greeting on arrival together with a hot chocolate cookie, what can I say. The rooms are very clean and modern, you even get a radio alarm clock to wake you up, that's if you want to get out of bed as they are really comfortable. We have eaten in the restaurant and always had a nice meal, you are given a tablet/Ipad to take to your table to choose your wine from. Don't let the fact that it is at the airport put you off as I can honestly say I heard hardly any aircraft noise at all, no more than I would hear at home.
reviews.title: Worth it just for the cookies

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed whilst attending an 18th birthday party which was held in the hotel This is an outstanding hotel, clean, comfortable and great value for money. The service was efficient and helpful and the staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome. Not only will we as a family stay at the hotel when next in the area we will recommend it to others.
reviews.title: Doubletree Hilton Newcastle Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My stay at the hotel was uneventful the food we ate in the bar was expensive and bland the beer a complete rip off this establishment has a pervading air of snootiness allied with a rather pretentious outlook.A word to the wise be careful where you drop off here as you are likely to incur a hefty fine.£100 to be exact for dropping off my wife before parking in the car park. I called the hotel to ask for advice a spoke to a member of staff on reception to say he was difficult would be an understatement. I asked for advice on the matter and all he would say was you didn’t come into the hotel you have done a U turn you will be fined. When I said I know what I have done thank you he replied I would have helped you if it wasn't for your attitude. NICE chap. With a staff ethos like this and a pompous attitude to match you are better off looking elsewhere, the beer and parking here cost as much as a stay in a decent hotel elsewhere.
reviews.title: Beware stop here at your own risk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: this was the second time we have stayed at the Hilton Doubletree before flying from Newcastle Airport. the accommodation and staff are always good and when linked to 'meet and greet' parking it is excellent value.
reviews.title: ideal location before flying

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013
reviews.text: Just a pity that the restaurant franchise (Fratelli) didn't quite match the accommodation. I had an excellent risotto but my wife's veal was tough and chewy. And the chips which looked very good; flattered to deceive. Why do professional chefs have such difficulty in cooking good chips. These were nice and chunky but were hard inside.It is easy - part cook to soft in medium/hot fat and then crisp up in hot fat. However we will not let that little disappointment detract from staying here again or indeed using the restaurant.
reviews.title: Excellent service brilliant staff

aka: DoubleTree By Hilton Hotel Newcastle International Airport Newcastle Upon Tyne/Woolsington
description: Offering contemporary, upscale accommodation and ideally situated adjacent to the terminal building, express links to Newcastle city centre via Metro and the A1, it is the perfect hotel for business and leisure travellers.The hotel has five meeting rooms with inbuilt state-of-the-art AV and function suite to accommodate 40 to 150. Fratello’s restaurant offers guests a range of Italian cuisine with more informal dining options available in the hotel’s Columbus Bar. Boasting 179 spacious en-suite bedrooms with complimentary internet access, soundproof windows and luxurious Sweet Dreams beds; it also has a business centre, 24-hour room service, fitness centre, continental lounge and onsite car parking including Park and Fly options.
